html: Instead of their light breaking through like the dawn, their healing taking effect, and their righteousness going before them in the new exodus (Isaiah 58:8), the wicked are left to their own devices. Once the righteous are withdrawn from impending calamity (Isaiah 57:1), the wicked are subjected to the powers of darkness (Isaiah 5:30). Those who worked in the dark, thinking to hide their schemes from Jehovah (Isaiah 29:15), are banished into outer darkness (Isaiah 8:22). Those who wrought injustices (Isaiah 5:7) experience Jehovah’s justice instead of his everlasting salvation (Isaiah 1:23-24; 51:6).
